World.title: Deadly blast rips through congested street near New Delhi’s Red Fort
World.description: An explosion near New Delhi’s Red Fort reportedly has killed at least eight people.

World.title: Syrian President Sharaa makes the 1st White House visit by a Syrian head of state
World.description: Formerly aligned with al-Qaida with a U.S. bounty on his head, Ahmed al-Sharaa became Syria's president after leading the rebels who toppled the country's authoritarian Assad regime.

World.title: Former French president Sarkozy released from prison after three weeks
World.description: The former French president was jailed in October for conspiring to fund his election campaign with money from late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi.

World.title: Typhoon Fung-wong destroys homes in the Philippines
World.description: Evacuees face returning to destroyed homes and flooded streets after Super Typhoon Fung‑Wong hit the Philippines.

World.title: The government shutdown has escalated the US war on the poor
World.description: For the ruling elite, poor Americans are expendable.

World.title: Syria’s al-Sharaa on historic visit to US, here’s what you need to know
World.description: The Syrian president will visit the White House, a first for any leader from post-independence Syria.

World.title: Police say eight people killed in blast near Red Fort in India’s New Delhi
World.description: Local television channels report at least 11 people wounded in the blast.

World.title: It is time to give Africans a stake in African growth
World.description: African countries need to change rules and regulations to stimulate African investment in start-ups.

World.title: Why has hero status for Indonesia’s Soeharto caused outrage?
World.description: Indonesia’s government has bestowed ‘national hero’ status on former president Soeharto. The award has caused uproar.

World.title: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy to be released from prison
World.description: Sarkozy was found guilty of criminal conspiracy for his role in securing funding for his 2007 presidential campaign.

World.title: Thailand suspends Cambodia peace deal after landmine blast
World.description: Thailand says 'hostility ... has not decreased' and deal on hold until Cambodia meets unspecified demands.

World.title: Riot in Ecuador prison kills 31 amid gunfire and explosions
World.description: Ecuador’s prisons are among the deadliest in Latin America due to overcrowding, corruption and weak control.

World.title: Seven dead after migrant boat sinks near Thai-Malaysian border
World.description: Hundreds of Rohingyas, who fled Myanmar in hopes of a better life in Malaysia, remain missing.

World.title: Video: COP30 summit warned Gaza faces catastrophic environmental crisis
World.description: Palestine’s ambassador to Brazil at COP30 climate summit noted Israel’s genocide in Gaza added to the climate crisis.

World.title: Dozens of inmates found hanged in Ecuador prison

World.title: Senators reach deal to reopen the government. And, countries gather for climate talks

World.title: Daughter of ex-South African President Jacob Zuma denies terrorism charges
World.description: Zuma-Sambudla is accused of fuelling a wave of protests that hit South Africa after her father's arrest.

World.title: Iran dismisses US accusation of plot to kill Israeli ambassador in Mexico

World.title: Syrian president to meet with President Trump Monday
